intro: Euphrasia caucasica, commonly known as the Caucasian eyebright, is a herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or forested areas and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with fine pubescence, while its flowers are clustered in racemes. Euphrasia caucasica is valued in traditional medicine for its potential healing properties.
